intro: Adenia pumila, commonly known as the smooth adenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Passifloraceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale green in color. Adenia pumila is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively uncommon species within its native range.
